Based on your preference for films from 1963, I'd recommend watching "The Secret Garden." This film is a classic psychological thriller that offers a unique blend of espionage and intrigue, set against the backdrop of a global threat. Although it was actually released in 2011, the plot draws inspiration from a story written much earlier—in 1911—making it a captivating period piece. Enjoy!

For another recommendation closer to 1963, "Hitch" is a fascinating film about the meeting of two legendary filmmakers: Alfred Hitchcock and François Truffaut. It might not be an action-packed thriller like The Secret Garden, but it offers a glimpse into the world of cinema history.

If you're open to movies from more recent years, "The Rite" (2011) starring Anthony Hopkins could also be of interest.
